parameter.value:
# Import libraries from rdflib import Graph, Literal, RDFS, Namespace import pandas as pd import os
# Mandatory function for RapidMiner def rm_main(data): # Create the graph used to store the vocabulary g = Graph() # Create the Namespace for the vocabulary n = Namespace("http://www.liveschema.org/test/") g.bind("liveschema_test", n)
# Sort the DataFrame data = data.sort_values("total") # Iterate for every row present on data for index_, row in data.iterrows(): # Get the names of the domains and saves them using subClassOf and label names = row["Names"].replace(" ","").replace("[","").replace("]","").replace("'","").replace(",", "_-_") nameList = names.split("_-_") print(names) for name in nameList: g.add((n[names], RDFS.label, Literal(name))) if(name != names): g.add((n[name], RDFS.subClassOf, n[names]))
# Map every element into its domain elements = row["Elements"].replace(" ","").replace("[","").replace("]","").replace("'","").split(",") print(elements) for element in elements: g.add((n[element], RDFS.domain, n[names]))
# Create the directory in which store the new vocabulary location = os.path.normpath(os.path.expanduser("~/Desktop/K-Files/Converted/")) if not os.path.isdir(location): os.makedirs(location) # Serialize the new vocabulary g.serialize(destination=str(os.path.join(location, "test.rdf")), format="pretty-xml") g.serialize(destination=str(os.path.join(location, "test.n3")), format="n3") g.serialize(destination=str(os.path.join(location, "test.nt")), format="nt") g.serialize(destination=str(os.path.join(location, "test.ttl")), format="turtle") g.serialize(destination=str(os.path.join(location, "test.json-ld")), format="json-ld")

process.description: Convert the CrossData obtained from the KnowledgeAnalyser and generate the relative new vocabulary in various formats into the folder Desktop/K-Files/Converted
